answers.author: Michael Smith
answers.text:
It is The City of Oklahoma City’s policy that each department will develop a strategic business plan that incorporates a full family of measures including outcome or result measures that demonstrate the benefits being provided to its customers.  These goals and results are reviewed frequently.  The purpose of our Economic Development program is to provide business attraction, expansion and retention services to the business community so the citizens can benefit from the creation and retention of jobs paying the Oklahoma City MSA average wage or greater.
Our Economic Development measures are:
Results                              
% above the Oklahoma City MSA average wage for new jobs created through incentives 
% of new jobs paying above the Oklahoma City MSA average wage
$ of private investment leveraged per dollar of public investment
Outputs                                                     
of jobs created
of jobs created through incentives
of companies receiving incentives
Demands
of companies qualifying for incentives
Efficiency
$ expenditure per job created paying the Oklahoma City MSA average wage or greater
Additional information can be found on our public performance reporting link: http://www.okc.gov/finance_tab/LFRForCitizens/Forms/LFRMetrics.aspx
